intro: Ripartia croatica, commonly known as the Croatian split-leaf plant, is a member of the Rutaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or yellow in color. Ripartia croatica is native to parts of southeastern Europe, including Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
